body_html:
Odd. I had only done a stupidly simple test before (x = tf.Variable(1.0) ... print(sess.run(x))), so I was worried it wouldn't work for me either, but it does:

body:
Odd. I had only done a stupidly simple test before (`x = tf.Variable(1.0)` ... `print(sess.run(x))`), so I was worried it wouldn't work for me either, but it does:

```
I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_bfc_allocator.cc:107] Allocating 10.57GiB bytes.
I tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_bfc_allocator.cc:118] GPU 0 memory begins at 0x2303ee0000 extends to 0x25a8ae0e67
2016-03-04 12:37:58.181180: step 0, loss = 4.68 (3.8 examples/sec; 34.059 sec/batch)
2016-03-04 12:38:01.405984: step 10, loss = 4.65 (502.8 examples/sec; 0.255 sec/batch)
2016-03-04 12:38:03.791843: step 20, loss = 4.64 (533.8 examples/sec; 0.240 sec/batch)
2016-03-04 12:38:06.084344: step 30, loss = 4.61 (571.2 examples/sec; 0.224 sec/batch)
```

My specs:

```
CentOS 6.7
gcc 4.8.2
Tesla K80
cuda 7.0
cudnn 6.5
compute capability 3.5
NVIDIA-SMI 352.63     Driver Version: 352.63
```
